Master Answer:
Otezla® (apremilast) is a medication to treat plaque psoriasis or psoriatic arthritis. Medications that lower the immune system interfere with the body's response to live vaccines, such as the measles, mumps, rubella (MMR) vaccine.  In BC,  the primary care physician, medical specialist or nurse practitioner most familiar with your current medical status must complete a referral form giving permission to get a live vaccine.
Please speak with your health care provider or a nurse at a local health unit for more information. Use the health unit finder.
Immunization Nurse
Master Question: Should a person receive a second measles vaccination while on Otezla?
